common_errors.cause: System activity data collection is not enabled or no data for requested day
common_errors.solution: Enable sysstat: sudo systemctl enable --now sysstat; Data is collected daily, wait for collection.

common_errors.cause: Data file is corrupted or from incompatible sysstat version
common_errors.solution: Check sysstat version consistency. Data files aren't portable between versions.

common_errors.cause: Requested metric (-n, -r, etc.) wasn't collected in the data file
common_errors.solution: Edit /etc/sysstat/sysstat to enable collection. Use SADC_OPTIONS for additional metrics.

common_errors.cause: Data file format version mismatch (different sysstat version created it)
common_errors.solution: Use sadf to convert between formats, or regenerate data with current version

common_errors.cause: The -e end time is before -s start time
common_errors.solution: Ensure start time (-s HH:MM:SS) is before end time (-e HH:MM:SS)

common_errors.cause: Time argument not in expected HH:MM:SS format
Data file for specified date doesn't exist
common_errors.solution: Check available files: ls /var/log/sa/. Use -f to specify different path.

common_errors.cause: Cannot read system activity data files
common_errors.solution: Data files in /var/log/sa/ may need sudo to read, or add user to appropriate group

common_errors.cause: System activity data collector not installed
common_errors.solution: Install sysstat package: apt install sysstat / yum install sysstat

common_errors.cause: Data collection hasn't run yet for current period
common_errors.solution: Wait for cron job to collect data, or manually run: /usr/lib/sysstat/sa1 1 1
